title: Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Music Cabinet", March 15, 1937
medium: Graphite, red, and blue color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 8578/F.S./ANDERSON, OLSSON/DILLM./D./ 3/5/37, 3/13/37, 1, MASTERCR.; above stamp in graphite: ONE MUSIC CABINET 34 3/4 X 13 1/2 X 48 " HIGH/LAUREL/INTERIOR WALNUT/PEWTER INLAY FRONT SEE SPEC. DRAW./SIX DRAWERS ON CENTRE GUIDES - STOPPERS/TWO SLIDES - STOPPERS/ONE DOOR ON LEFT SIDE - BULLET CATCH/TWO ADJUST. SHELVES/USE DOMES OF SILENCE; dimensions, instructions, materials in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawings for music cabinet for Anderson house. Rectangular cabinet with laurel exterior and walnut interior. Pewter inlay on front surface of abstract guitar over keyboard (?). Six drawers (3 on each side) near top; cabinet door on left side below drawers. Two adjustable shelves inside cabinet.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Music Cabinet", March 15, 1937.
March 15, 1937. Graphite, red, and blue color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-957.
